pros: Co-workers awesome,Diversity and advancement opportunities
cons: none at this time now

pros: Schedule was good for work/life balance
cons: The Long hours per shift

pros:
The medical benefits are incredible and there are many perks to being an employee. If you get medical services done within the Pocono Health System, all you owe is a $10 copay, regardless of PCP or specialist. Everything else gets adjusted off as a courtesy for being a PMC employee. There are discounts all over town (like at restaurants, hotels, BJs, the Crossings, etc) for being a PHS employee. The billing department also requires no weekends- this is a Monday-Friday position and off on holidays.

The job itself is also good. Everyday tasks include answering patient phone calls, calling insurance companies to dispute denials, and working claims to submit to insurance companies or preparing denials and accurately billing the patients. A lot to learn, but fun.
cons: Definitely feel the "growing pains" as the hospital keeps expanding but the department sizes stay the same. Additional hires would benefit the billing department. No room for advancement or promotion. Salary is also on the lower side compared to other health networks, but the benefits do make up for some of this.

pros: Good pay, better than the competitors with the big names. Good opportunities to keep up with yearly skills review. When I came here, hospital had a poor reputation in the community, but management put great staff in place, upgraded equipment and was finally turning itself around.
cons: Bought out by big name hospital so salary so pay increases not being given as usual despite doing "more with less", and  hours/personnel changed,  blaming employee for their work instead of explaining the economic truth.  Per diem and part time  staff used so management doesn't have to pay benefits or salary of more senior staff person. Lost some great staff people

pros: I have worked at Pocono Health System since 2004 and can honestly say that I've always been treated very well here by my managers and co-workers. I've been lucky to work in collaborative environments here where my colleagues and managers consider my input and ideas. You are expected to work hard, and on some days the hours can be long, but in my experience here the hard work is appreciated. Management recognized the areas where I excelled, and supported me as I changed positions. PHS gives excellent benefits and salaries as well. I've met some of my closest friends working at PHS. Also, it's been nice to see the growth here at PHS over the years and all we've accomplished as a team. I've enjoyed my time working at PHS and would highly recommend employment here.
cons: I really have nothing negative to say about this organization.

pros: I've been employed for 5 years at Pocono Medical Center (PMC), which was rated as one of the top 150 great places to work in healthcare. PMC really is a high level community hospital that truly cares about providing excellent care to patients!  As a trauma center, there are also many specialties (Cardiac, Oncology, NICU, Stroke center... too many to name!) and the physician network is growing with new locations throughout the region. It is wonderful to work at a healthcare organization that is committed to the community and patient safety!  Nice people too!
cons: PA winters are cold!

pros: Various educational seminars, CE credits, comprehensive health benefits, paid time off, sick leave and short term disability. Managers are approachable and willing to work with the employees' busy schedules. There are always events for the employees and their families that benefit the communities within the Pocono area!
cons: Starting salaries for aide's could be a little higher to meet the demand of the rising economy. No uniform incentives, so uniforms are an out of pocket expense. Nothing more to add because everyone within the company will do whatever is necessary to help their employees.

pros: strive to make patient experience the best
cons: does not acknowledge talented staff. Should try to retain , recognize and rehire staff that have done good work and made contributions to the improvement of care.

pros: Focused on patient care, management listens and takes action, people are willing to go the extra mile when patients are in need, employees help each other.
cons: Unhealthy culture encouraging "throwing under the bus", too much emphasis on troubleshooting by assigning blame, overly focused on competitors.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Great peers to work with - a lot of help and support.  You never feel like you are drowning.  It felt like home.  Management would include staff in meetings regarding EMR that was being built and included us in committees.
cons: Administration did not address current serious concerns with staff.

job_title: Senior Operations Management in Budd Lake, NJ
pros:
•	Provide hands on approach with PC hardware/software deployment, helpdesk & Desktop support, storage area network,         data center operations/productions control and change & problem management.
•	Resolve technical hardware and software issues at desk side, as well as provide technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to computer systems, software, and hardware via telephone.
cons: This was an excellent opportunity to learn the Health Care Industry.

review_title: Dietary is OK as long as you don't get caught up in all the gossip
pros: The hours are great compared to working in a traditional restaurant. You get every other weekend off as well as paid vacation and paid holidays including benefits which are great
cons: Too much drama in the kitchen. As long as you keep to yourself do your work and don't get involved with the gossip and hearsay

job_title: Surgery Facilitator in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Good working conditiond..great team work. Love working with the patients and families. Good employee benefits and nice work environment.
cons: To far from my home. I recently moved back to NJ and don't like the commute. I'm looking for something closer to home.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: A lot of good educational opportunities and benefits.
cons: The staff is extremely negative. They don't have anything positive to say and really don't do anything in the way of helping out new nurses. Management is an utter disaster and the hospital funds are poorly mismanaged. No one seems to know what they're doing. The work environment is cramped and chaotic. I would never want to be a patient here and I'm nearly certain the hospital is running itself right into the ground.

review_title: Is a good opportunity to move up
pros: Team work and ability to learn. Great place place to move up, everyone is friendly and always willing to teach each other
cons: Lay over because they allow you to grow there is always a layover of jobs and also managers right now I don't have a manger because she is now senior manger

job_title: Registration Clerk in East Stroudsburg, PA
pros: Steady employment, great benefits when you can use them.
cons: Long hours, don't appreciate your work or time put in.  No room for advancement unless you have a degree in radiology or nurse or some kind of specialty.

review_title: It was good at first but once I got injured on the job, noone cared about me or my health.

cons: Unorganized staff. When short staff , you work your butt off and you don't really get credit for the good job you do.

review_title: Its a good job to have in this town

cons: I have nothing negative to say.

pros: Client engagement/ services are rewarding

pros: Health Insurance PTO Great work peers

pros: - Ability to gain hours for LCPC license - Working in a clinical setting with other professionals - Free supervision
cons: - Pay - Poor Work/life balance - Support

review_title: Very unhealthy workplace, Extremely poor pay.
pros: They did have some occasional hybrid work. Although, it was temporary.
cons: Very low pay Very high caseloads of up to 25 people Hostile work environment. Supervisors tolerate racism on the job from employees, for the sake of having help. Blatant disrespect from supervisors. Also a lot of favoritism.

pros: Working with the clients and seeing them progress and get to their baseline in their behaviors and mental stability.
cons:
Staff will try to place blame on you for the smallest mistakes or actions. 
If you defend yourself from a client harming you or threatening you, they will keep the client in the program.
The pay is bare minimum of $16.25.
The current program manager at the specified location painted themselves as a hard worker while other staff did everything. 
If a staff member was out due to health issues for a significant amount of time, the program manager would place all of the work on the previous assistant manager. 
Staff culture is toxic and cliquish. They will usually paint you as an issue if they do not like you and will not help you in any regards of your work.

pros: • acquired great clerical skills • fun office staff • great benefits • learn how to multitask • learn great conflict resolution skills for in person and over the phone
cons: • high stress from providers and clients • paperwork

pros: Great clients and opportunity to learn new things.
cons: Poor pay and far too much work for the pay.

pros: some Coworkers there to help when needed. Had great management
cons: No Raises. Competitive environment with certain coworkers.

pros: Location was good for me, liked working with patients
cons: The management needs additional training. The management creates a hostile work environment in the clerical unit at Catonsville location. I would not recommend the office assistant position to anyone. A very unprofessional work environment with little to no room for growth  or pay advancement. The staff seems untrust worthy and not very supportive at all.  They seem very professionally insecure in their positions and seem to view newcomers as a threat to their jobs or authority. Not very welcoming! Go somewhere else. They have a hard time keeping people in the position. Now I know why! Ghetto City! Sad!

pros: Great benefits, good relationship with some clients.
cons: Supervisor is very rude and will walk all over you. Co-workers were awesome, but a very negative environment by supervisor. Very unprofessional and highschool like. When you would need help, supervisor would not provide assistance and expect you to figure it out on your own. I don't recommend this job to someone that wants to move forward in the mental health field. You will be taken advantage of, and treated poorly by the supervisor if you aren't on her "good side."

pros:
-Experience navigating social and governmental agencies
-exposure to actual lived experience with mental illness
-Coworkers were supportive and understanding of your stress
cons:
-Unsupportive and authoritarian  management
-Unrealistic expectations for time and work
-Not client-centered services

review_title: Do NOT work here-Catonsville OR branch
pros: The clients, sometimes free coffee, and co-workers were helpful in dealing with the manager.
cons: The manager is incompetent, unorganized, indecisive, and selfish- all which make a terrible leader. The program manager has no business being where she is (she was promoted because there wasn't another option) and will not only be terrible to you, but doesn't care the slightest about clients. You will be fooled by the happy go lucky personality she has...but don't be. The co workers are miserable and have no sense of leadership. Again, if you're interested in outreach-it's a great program and job, just avoid Catonsville OR with your life.

review_title: Supportive coworkers, management needs work, lots of office politics
pros: Clients are amazing, cool to watch them progress, good benefits (6 weeks of PTO), ability to go on day-long (fun) trips and get paid for it
cons: Politics, manager has favorites, unsure if raises exist here unless you move to a higher position, loss of valuable employees because of said politics

job_title: Psychiatric Rehabilitation Counselor in Catonsville, MD
pros: Takes good care of employees, good benefits, encourages personal career growth, good training opportunities, great place to start career in mental health
cons: No pay raises for employees (despite superior yearly employee evaluations), lack of communication within company and individual offices, management problems in some programs within company

pros: Great coworkers,great clients,great benefits, vacation time.
cons: Poor management which may be because of the low salaries,poor communication,poor business management.

pros: Excellent benefits and flexibility,clients are great to work with on a daily basis.
cons: Management is POOR at the Dundalk office!!! Ineffective program management with lack of training ,experience,organization  and people skills. The program manager has NO clue or idea on how to supervise employees, handle crisis,stressful situations ,communicate effectively or work with clients ,and poor decision making skill.

review_title: Good start for therapists in training
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Aberdeen, MD
pros: Wonderful therapists who truly care about the clients. They have generous benefits and PTO. Management can be very flexible depending in life circumstances. They provide good training opportunities.
cons: A lot of politics behind the scenes. There are limited opportunities for advancement and do not seem to care to retain valuable employees.

pros: Great place to get experience as an LGPC or LCSW. Supportive team members and a fairly flexible work environment. Excellent clerical support. Opportunities for free CEUs
cons: Low compensation. Minimal opportunities for advancement and company does not offer raises based on experience. High no show rate given community mental health setting.

pros: Excellent psychiatric staff and co-workers, variety of mental health situations, great place to learn, regular supervision meetings, lunches with drug reps and other community resources, large offices
cons: Pay, lack of advancement opportunities

pros: Great place to develop clinical skills.  Wonderful co-workers.  Lots of clinical supervision.  30 days of PTO.  Good health insurance.  Flexible scheduling, as needed.
cons: Low pay.  Poor building maintenance.

job_title: Psychiatric Rehabilitation Counselor in Aberdeen, MD
pros: The people are fantastic, a fair work environment, welcome to creativity
cons: A lot of job responsibilities outside of pay grade.

pros: faced paced, dynamic, diverse environment, great supervision and experience available
